Class Customer

java.lang.Object
Customer
public class Customer
extends java.lang.Object
Class representing a customer. Contains customer data and methods to create and save an account to customers.txt, or to access an existing account from customers.txt.

  • Constructor Details

    • Customer

      private Customer​(java.lang.String fn, java.lang.String ln, java.lang.String pn, java.lang.String e, java.lang.String sa, java.lang.String c, java.lang.String s, java.lang.String z, java.lang.String pw, boolean isGuest) throws java.io.IOException
      Private constructor used when creating a new account or creating a guest account DO NOT CALL TO CREATE A CUSTOMER! Use createAccount() or createGuestAccount().
      Parameters:
      fn - First name
      ln - Last name
      pn - Phone number
      e - Email address
      sa - Street Address
      c - City
      s - State
      z - ZIP code
      pw - Password
      isGuest - True if this is only a guest account, false if this is a new account to be saved
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if Customer.incrementNumCustomers() fails

    • Customer

      private Customer​(java.lang.String fn, java.lang.String ln, java.lang.String pn, java.lang.String e, java.lang.String sa, java.lang.String c, java.lang.String s, java.lang.String z, java.lang.String pw, int existingID)
      Private constructor used when retrieving an account from the database DO NOT CALL TO CREATE A CUSTOMER! Use retrieveAccount() or createGuestAccount().
      Parameters:
      fn - First name
      ln - Last name
      pn - Phone number
      e - Email address
      sa - Street Address
      c - City
      s - State
      z - ZIP code
      pw - Password
      existingID - ID of customer's account

  • Method Details

    • createAccount

      public static Customer createAccount​(java.lang.String fn, java.lang.String ln, java.lang.String pn, java.lang.String e, java.lang.String sa, java.lang.String c, java.lang.String s, java.lang.String z, java.lang.String pw) throws java.lang.Exception
      Creates a new customer account and saves it to the database
      Parameters:
      fn - First name
      ln - Last name
      pn - Phone number
      e - Email address
      sa - Street address
      c - City
      s - State
      z - ZIP
      pw - Password
      Returns:
      A Customer object with the included information, that has been saved to the database with a unique ID
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.Exception

    • createGuestAccount

      public static Customer createGuestAccount​(java.lang.String fn, java.lang.String ln, java.lang.String pn, java.lang.String sa, java.lang.String c, java.lang.String s, java.lang.String z) throws java.io.IOException
      Creates a guest customer account
      Parameters:
      fn - First name
      ln - Last name
      pn - Phone number
      sa - Street address
      c - City
      s - State
      z - ZIP
      Returns:
      A Customer object with the included information, and an ID of -1
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an IO error occured or if Customer.incrementNumCustomers() fails

    • retrieveAccount

      public static Customer retrieveAccount​(java.lang.String phoneNum, java.lang.String password) throws java.lang.Exception
      Searches for an account in the database using a phone number and password
      Parameters:
      phoneNum - The phone number tied to the customer's account
      password - The password tied to the customer's account
      Returns:
      A Customer object with the account's information and ID
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if no customer is found with that information

    • saveCustomer

      private static void saveCustomer​(Customer customer) throws java.io.IOException
      Saves a Customer to the database as a string in the format:

      id,first name,last name,phone number,email,password,full address

      Parameters:
      customer - The Customer object to be saved
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If customers.txt cannot be accessed for any reason

    • deleteAccount

      public static boolean deleteAccount​(int customerID) throws java.io.IOException
      Attempts to delete the account with the specified ID
      Parameters:
      customerID - The ID number of the account to delete
      Returns:
      True if successful, false if customer could not be found
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If customers.txt cannot be accessed for any reason

    • incrementNumCustomers

      private static int[] incrementNumCustomers() throws java.io.IOException
      Increments the current and total number of customers and updates customers.txt to reflect these new values.
      Returns:
      An array of integers, where [0] is the current number of stored customers and [1] is the total number of customers that have ever been stored
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If customers.txt cannot be accessed for any reason

    • decrementNumCustomers

      private static int[] decrementNumCustomers() throws java.io.IOException
      Decrements the number of current customers and updates customers.txt to reflect these new values. If for some reason either value attempts to go below zero, the file will be reset so that both values are zero and there are no accounts saved
      Returns:
      An array of integers, where [0] is the current number of stored customers and [1] is the total number of customers
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If customers.txt cannot be accessed for any reason

    • getNumCustomers

      private static int[] getNumCustomers() throws java.io.IOException
      Gets the current number of customers stored in customers.txt, and the total number of customers that have been stored (including deleted entires).
      Returns:
      an array of integers, where [0] = current number of customers,[1] = total number of customers
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If customers.txt cannot be accessed for any reason

    • validatePhoneNumber

      public static boolean validatePhoneNumber​(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
      Validates that a provided phone number is, in fact, a valid phone number.

      Uses Google's libphonenumber library

      Parameters:
      phoneNumber - The number to be validated
      Returns:
      True if the number is a valid phone number

    • reformatPhoneNumber

      public static java.lang.String reformatPhoneNumber​(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
      Reformats the provided number to Customer.DEFAULT_PHONE_NUMBER_FORMAT, and returns the modified string
      Parameters:
      phoneNumber - The number to be reformatted
      Returns:
      A new string consisting of phoneNumber reformatted to Customer.DEFAULT_PHONE_NUMBER_FORMAT. Returns phoneNumber if phoneNumber is not a valid phone number
